anchor.surface_text: The present application has been made under section 8 of the U. P. Debt Redemption Act, 1940, subsection  1  of which, omitting the proviso, runs as follows-- Notwithstanding the provisions of any decree, or of any law for the time being in force, an agriculturist or a workman liable to pay the amount due under a decree to which this Act applies passed before the companymencement of this Act, may apply to the Civil Court which passed the decree or to which the execution of the decree has been transferred, for the amendment of the decree by reduction according to the provisions of this Act of the amount due under it,

arguments.claim: Decree applies if in suit relating to loan; loan is advance recoverable from agriculturist prima facie when becomes recoverable

anchor.surface_text: Under section 2 6  of the Act the phrase decree to which this Act applies means a decree passed before or after the companymencement of this Act in a suit to which this Act applies. Section 2 17  defines the phrase suit to which this Act applies as meaning any suit or proceeding relating to a loan. The question then, arises was the decree under which the judgment-debtors applicants are liable passed in a suit relating to a loan ? holdings.text: There are three pre-requisites for an application under section 8(1) of the U.P. Debt Redemption Act, 1940: (1) the applicant must be an agriculturist or workman; (2) liable to pay amount due under a decree to which the Act applies; (3) the decree passed before commencement of the Act.

anchor.surface_text: It is clear from the wording of the sub-section that there are three pre-requisites for exercise of the right conferred by it, namely, (1) that the application must be by an agriculturist and (2) that that agriculturist must be liable to pay the amount due under a decree to which this Act applies and (3) that that decree was passed before the commencement of this Act.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Direct textual interpretation of section 8(1) wording.

holdings.text: The judgment-debtors applicants were agriculturists within the meaning of the Act at the date of suit, decree, application and relevant prior dates including July 28, 1931.

anchor.surface_text: had Sita Ram ceased to be an agriculturist by reason of clause (b) of the provi- so to section 2(3), that is to say, by reason of his being assessed to income-tax on July 28, 1931. According to the evidence of Surai Mani Tripathi and Sita Ram income-tax was first deducted at the source in the month of February 1932 by the College authorities and the actual assessment was made on February 9, 1933.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Evidence of witnesses and acquittance roll shows first income-tax deduction February 1932; salary below taxable minimum pre-1932; others admitted.

holdings.text: Sita Ram was not assessed to income-tax on July 28, 1931, and remained an agriculturist on that date.

anchor.surface_text: Therefore, Sita Ram was not assessed to income-tax on July 28. 1931. It is not disputed that the taxable minimum was reduced from Rs. 2,000 perannum to Rs. 1,000 per annum by the Indian Finance Supplementary Extending Act, 1931, which was enacted on November 26, 1931.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Unrebutted witness testimony, acquittance roll, assessment form dated 1933 for 1931-32; taxable minimum reduction post-date.

holdings.text: The decree is one to which the Act applies as passed in a suit relating to a loan; loan defined as advance recoverable from agriculturist (prima facie when becomes recoverable).

anchor.surface_text: The only question that remains is whether the amount was due under a decree to which the Act applies. Under section 2(6) of the Act the phrase decree to which this Act applies means a decree passed before or after the commencement of this Act in a suit to which this Act applies. Section 2(17) defines the phrase suit to which this Act applies as meaning any suit or proceeding relating to a loan.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Statutory definitions s2(6), s2(17), s2(9); advance recoverable from agriculturists.

holdings.text: The debt advanced under the 1931 mortgage deed constitutes a loan under section 2(9) as recoverable from agriculturists.

anchor.surface_text: Under section 2(6) of the Act the phrase decree to which this Act applies means a decree passed before or after the commencement of this Act in a suit to which this Act applies. Section 2(17) defines the phrase suit to which this Act applies as meaning any suit or proceeding relating to a loan. The question then, arises was the decree under which the judgment-debtors applicants are liable passed in a suit relating to a loan ?

holdings.reasoning_summary: Fits definition: advance recoverable from agriculturist/workman/property thereof.

holdings.text: Assuming without deciding that proviso to s2(9) requires advance made to agriculturist at date of advance, the condition is satisfied as Sita Ram was agriculturist on July 28, 1931.

anchor.surface_text: Loan is thus defined in sec- tion 2(9) Loan means an advance in cash or kind made before the first day of June, 1940, recoverable from an agriculturist or a workman or from any such person and other persons jointly or from the property of an agriculturist or workman... Provided that an advance recoverable from an agricul- turist or from an agriculturist and other persons jointly shall not be deemed to be a loan for the purposes of this Act unless such advance was made to an agriculturist or to an agriculturist and other persons jointly.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Assumed arguendo; but facts show agriculturist status confirmed independently.

holdings.text: Accounts to be reopened from June 2, 1922, as mortgagees in both mortgages were the same so far as judgment-debtors concerned; point not contested below.

anchor.surface_text: Sri G.N. Kunzru finally submitted that in any case the accounts could not be taken from 1922, for the mortgagees under the two mortgages were different. We have already pointed out that this point was not specifically taken in the decree-holders petition of objection. The trial Court held as a fact that so far as the judgment-debtors were concerned the mortgagees were the same in both the mortgages.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Not raised in objections; lower court factual finding on identity of mortgagees accepted; no evidence adduced by decree-holders.

The Indian Finance (Supplementary & Extending) Act 1931 provides the legal context for the timing and nature of income-tax assessment relevant to determining agriculturist status on July 28, 1931, as reflected in the clustering of these nodes.

The Act applies to the factual and legal question of income-tax assessment on July 28, 1931, for determining agriculturist status, as indicated by the issue's focus and node clustering. [REPAIRED: applies->addresses]

anchor.surface_text: Therefore, Sita Ram was not assessed to income-tax on July 28. 1931. It is not disputed that the taxable minimum was reduced from Rs. 2,000 perannum to Rs. 1,000 per annum by the Indian Finance Supplementary Extending Act, 1931, which was enacted on November 26, 1931.

anchor.surface_text: The Courts below therefore, were right in their conclusion that the judgment-debtors applicants were entitled to the benefit of the Act.

Under section 2(6) of the Act the phrase decree to which this Act applies means a decree passed before or after the commencement of this Act in a suit to which this Act applies. Section 2(17) defines the phrase suit to which this Act applies as meaning any suit or proceeding relating to a loan. The question then, arises was the decree under which the judgment-debtors applicants are liable passed in a suit relating to a loan ?
The Courts below therefore, were right in their conclusion that the judgment-debtors applicants were entitled to the benefit of the Act.

anchor.surface_text: Loan is thus defined in sec- tion 2(9) Loan means an advance in cash or kind made before the first day of June, 1940, recoverable from an agriculturist or a workman or from any such person and other persons jointly or from the property of an agriculturist or workman... Provided that an advance recoverable from an agricul- turist or from an agriculturist and other persons jointly shall not be deemed to be a loan for the purposes of this Act unless such advance was made to an agriculturist or to an agriculturist and other persons jointly.
